description: From drupe (“stone fruit”) +‎ -let (diminutive suffix). Compare Late Latin drupella (“small ripe olive”).

entries.meaning: (botany) One of the small drupe-like subdivisions which compose the outer layer of certain fruit such as blackberries or raspberries. [from mid 19th c.]
examples: It is best to pick the berries while all drupelets are of a consistent, dark red coloration.
The passengers on the chock-full boat were packed across the deck like drupelets.
